description.zh-cn: 指中国在文化大革命结束后，通过1977年和1978年恢复的高考所招收的两个年级的大学生。这一群体因其独特的时代背景、刻苦的学习精神以及在改革开放后社会各领域发挥的重要作用而备受关注。
description.en: Refers to the two cohorts of university students enrolled through the restored National College Entrance Examination (Gaokao) in 1977 and 1978, following the end of the Cultural Revolution in China. This group is notable for its unique historical context, diligent study habits, and the significant roles its members played in various sectors during the Reform and Opening-up era.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国时期的一场重大政治运动，导致高考中断，并对中国的教育体系造成了严重破坏。
description.en: A major political movement in the People's Republic of China which led to the suspension of the Gaokao and caused severe damage to China's education system.

nodes.id: 普通高等学校招生全国统一考试

zh-cn: 普通高等学校招生全国统一考试

description.zh-cn: 中国的大学入学考试。该考试自1965年起中断，于1977年恢复，对中国社会产生了深远影响，并直接促成了“77-78级”大学生的产生。
description.en: The university entrance examination in China. It was suspended from 1965 and reinstated in 1977, an event that had a profound impact on Chinese society and directly led to the creation of the 'Class of 77-78'.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，在1977年8月第三次复出后，主持决定恢复高考制度。
description.en: A Chinese politician who, after his third political rehabilitation in August 1977, presided over the decision to restore the Gaokao system.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的机关报，于1977年10月22日发表文章，正式向全国宣布恢复高考的消息。
description.en: The official newspaper of the Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party, which published an article on October 22, 1977, formally announcing the restoration of the Gaokao to the nation.

description.zh-cn: “知识青年”的简称，指在文化大革命期间从城市被派往农村地区接受“贫下中农再教育”的青年。恢复高考对他们而言是改变命运的重大机遇。
description.en: An abbreviation for 'intellectual youth', referring to the young people sent from cities to rural areas for 're-education from poor and lower-middle peasants' during the Cultural Revolution. The restoration of Gaokao was a life-changing opportunity for them.

en: Up to the Mountains and Down to the Countryside Movement

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间的一场政治运动，将大量城市知识青年（知青）送往农村地区。
description.en: A political movement during the Cultural Revolution that sent large numbers of urban intellectual youth (Zhiqing) to rural areas.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在土地改革和文革时期划分的阶级成分，在“上山下乡”运动中负责对知青进行“再教育”。
description.en: A class designation defined by the Chinese Communist Party during the land reform and Cultural Revolution eras. They were tasked with the 're-education' of the sent-down youth during the 'Up to the Mountains and Down to the Countryside Movement'.

description.zh-cn: 1978年起中国实行的一项以经济建设为中心的国策。由于急需人才，77-78级毕业生在此期间发挥了重要作用。
description.en: A national policy of focusing on economic development initiated by China in 1978. Due to the urgent need for talent, graduates from the Class of 77-78 played a significant role during this period.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，78级大学生，现任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: Chinese politician, a member of the Class of 1978, and the current Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，77级大学生，曾任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: Chinese politician, a member of the Class of 1977, and former Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命时期盛行的一种观念，认为读书学习没有价值。77-78级大学生在当时坚持读书，克服了这一观念的影响。
description.en: A prevalent concept during the Cultural Revolution that held that studying and learning were useless. Students of the Class of 77-78 persisted in their studies, overcoming the influence of this idea.

description.zh-cn: 中国的一所著名大学，其一项研究结果显示，1977、1978年级的学生中，知识分子家庭出身的比例达到历史最高水平。
description.en: A renowned university in China, whose research findings indicated that the proportion of students from intellectual families in the Classes of 1977 and 1978 reached a historical high.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，78级研究生。
description.en: Chinese politician, a postgraduate student of the Class of 1978.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，78级大学生。
description.en: Chinese politician, a member of the Class of 1978.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，77级大学生。
description.en: Chinese politician, a member of the Class of 1977.

description.zh-cn: 中国作家、社会活动家，77级大学生。
description.en: Chinese writer and social activist, a member of the Class of 1977.

description.zh-cn: 中国电影导演，77级大学生。
description.en: Chinese film director, a member of the Class of 1977.

description.zh-cn: 中国投资家，77级大学生。
description.en: Chinese investor, a member of the Class of 1977.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，77级大学生。
description.en: Chinese politician, a member of the Class of 1977.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间通过单位推荐而非入学考试方式进入大学的学生群体。
description.en: A group of students who entered universities during the Cultural Revolution through recommendation from their work units rather than by entrance examination.

description.zh-cn: 中国的大学及以上层次的教育体系，在文化大革命期间受到严重破坏。
description.en: The system of university-level and higher education in China, which was severely damaged during the Cultural Revolution.

description.en: The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China, which is the highest state administrative organ.

description.en: The Cultural Revolution caused a long-term suspension of the National College Entrance Examination (Gaokao).

description.zh-cn: 文本指出，文化大革命时期中国大学教育受到严重破坏。
description.en: The text states that university education in China was severely damaged during the Cultural Revolution.

relationships.target: 普通高等学校招生全国统一考试

description.zh-cn: 1977年8月，邓小平主持召开科学和教育工作座谈会，决定恢复高考。
description.en: In August 1977, Deng Xiaoping presided over a symposium on science and education, where the decision was made to restore the Gaokao.

relationships.target: 普通高等学校招生全国统一考试

description.en: On October 22, 1977, the People's Daily published an article, formally announcing the restoration of the Gaokao to the nation.

description.zh-cn: 1977年恢复高考，直接招收并形成了77-78级大学生群体。
description.en: The restoration of the Gaokao in 1977 directly led to the enrollment and formation of the Class of 77-78 university students.

relationships.source: 普通高等学校招生全国统一考试

description.zh-cn: 恢复高考的消息使得许多上山下乡的知青们感到鼓舞和兴奋，为他们提供了改变命运的机会。
description.en: The news of the Gaokao's restoration encouraged and excited many sent-down youths, providing them with an opportunity to change their fate.

description.zh-cn: 77-78级毕业生在急需人才的改革开放中发挥了重要作用。
description.en: Graduates of the Class of 77-78 played a significant role during the Reform and Opening-up era, which had an urgent need for talented individuals.

description.zh-cn: 上山下乡运动是文化大革命期间的一项重要政治运动。
description.en: The Up to the Mountains and Down to the Countryside Movement was a major political campaign during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 上山下乡运动将大量城市知识青年送往农村，形成了“知青”这一群体。
description.en: The Up to the Mountains and Down to the Countryside Movement sent large numbers of urban intellectual youth to the countryside, forming the 'Zhiqing' group.

description.zh-cn: 在“上山下乡”运动中，知青被要求接受贫下中农的再教育。
description.en: During the 'Up to the Mountains and Down to the Countryside Movement', the sent-down youth were required to undergo re-education from the poor and lower-middle peasants.

description.zh-cn: 由于文化大革命对中小学教育的破坏，77-78级学生普遍存在基础知识薄弱的弱点。
description.en: Due to the damage to primary and secondary education during the Cultural Revolution, students of the Class of 77-78 commonly had a weak foundation of basic knowledge.

description.zh-cn: 77-78级大学生在“读书无用论”盛行的时代依然坚持读书，该理论是他们求学路上的思想障碍。
description.en: The Class of 77-78 persisted in studying during an era when the 'theory that studying is useless' was prevalent, making this theory an ideological obstacle to their education.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间，大学招生采用推荐制，产生了工农兵学员这一群体。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, universities used a recommendation-based enrollment system, which produced the group of Worker-Peasant-Soldier students.
